original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge down on profit taking in the banking sector
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka‘s stocks edged down in mid day trade on profit taking in the baking index, the largest sector in the stock market on Tuesday, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
The main All Share Price Index was down 0.56 percent or 65.20 points to 11,616.46, the most liquid index S&P SL20 was down 0.59 percent or 20.49 points to 3,426.95.
The market has been seeing continuous gains over the past sessions based on confidence in economic stabilization.
Losers during mid day trade were Sampath Bank, Commercial Bank and Hatton National Bank. (Colombo/Aug08/2023)
